sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Physical and environmental pr</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The organization controls physical access to information system output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining the output.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Physical and Environmental Protection">b187f9fcdb211010280df36f299619ca</control_family> <control_name>Access Control for Output Devices</control_name> <control_number>PE-05</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>PE-05</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0011074</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:27</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>2</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 U.S.C. ยง552a(e)(10); FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; FISCAM: AC-6, AS-2; HIPAA: 45 C.F.R. ยง164.310(a)(1), 45 C.F.R. ยง164.310(b), 164.310(c); OMB Circular A-130: 7.g</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>PE-2, PE-3, PE-4, PE-18</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Controlling physical access to output devices includes, for example, placing output devices in locked rooms or other secured areas and allowing access to authorized individuals only and placing output devices in locations that can be monitored by organizational personnel. Monitors, printers, copiers, scanners, facsimile machines, and audio devices are examples of information system output devices.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  The access controls applied to output devices should be commensurate with the personally identifiable information (PII) confidentiality impact level. For example, human resource information is only sent to printers located in secured locations such as a locked suite.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:27</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>b587f9fcdb211010280df36f299619d4</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:27</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
